result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John Bernard Hodapp

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Bernard Hodapp not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for John Bernard Hodapp.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for status conference. Court waives defendant's appearance.
Defense requests resolution date.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John Bernard Hodapp not in court, in custody.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for John Bernard Hodapp.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record due to no court reporter availability. State is in compliance with victim notification. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 15 via Zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court, defendant John Bernard Hodapp not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery but not an offer and requests additional status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court, defendant John Bernard Hodapp not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Status Conference.  
Defense motion to withdraw as counsel due to a conflict.Court Granted defense motion to withdraw as counsel.
Attorney Ertl has notified   the SPD Office new counsel needs to be appointed.    
Parties advised: Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LAK and the incident location, 7169 West Fond Du Lac Avenue, in the City of Milwaukee, Milwaukee County,
Wisconsin
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant John Bernard Hodapp in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant John Bernard Hodapp in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  John Bernard Hodapp appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing may be streamed live through DACAST at the Court's discretion: 
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
